short_description: With a diverse landscape that includes the Carpathian Mountains and the Danube Delta, Romania is a nature lover's paradise. Discover the medieval towns of Transylvania, sample traditional cuisine like sarmale and mici, or visit the impressive Palace of the Parliament in Bucharest

tipping.hotels: Hotel tipping is customary in Romania. Tip 5 Lei per day to housekeeping and 5 Lei per bag to the porter
tipping.guides: Tour guides in Romania are usually tipped about 10-20 Lei per day
tipping.restaurants: Service charge normally isn't included SO add 5-10% for excellent service
tipping.taxis: Even on metered rides, tip 4-5 Lei or round up the fare

weather.title: Romania has a temperate-continental climate with hot summers and cold winters. It experiences moderate rainfall throughout the year, with the highest precipitation occurring during the summer months

when_to_visit.title: Sightseeing
when_to_visit.time_period: Spring (March to May), Autumn (September to November)
when_to_visit.short_description: Pleasant temperatures, generally mild weather, and are less crowded compared to the peak summer season. Landscapes are full of color, making it perfect to visit natural areas like the Carpathian Mountains

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot weather particularly in Southern regions. Black Sea resorts and mountainous areas will be more crowded during this period

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Temperatures can get cold, particularly in mountainous areas. Good time for winter sports

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Romania is from May to September when you can enjoy mild temperatures, longer daylight hours, and various cultural events and festivals held throughout the country
